009package Ch11_Circles_Ellipses;
010
011
012import static imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils.addToDialog;
013import static imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils.getFromDialog;
014
015import ij.ImagePlus;
016import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
017import ij.gui.NewImage;
018import ij.gui.PointRoi;
019import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
020import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
021import imagingbook.common.color.sets.BasicAwtColor;
022import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
023import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.GeometricEllipse;
024import imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.ellipse.utils.EllipseSampler;
025import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
026import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils.DialogLabel;
027import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils.DialogStringColumns;
028import imagingbook.common.ij.RoiUtils;
029import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ColoredStroke;
030import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ShapeOverlayAdapter;
031import imagingbook.common.util.ParameterBundle;
032
033/**
034 * Samples points on a given (ideal) circle and creates a new image with the
035 * sample points marked and also contained in a {@link PointRoi}. Image size,
036 * ellipse parameters and noise can be specified. The result can be used as a
037 * test image for circle fitting. Note that the resulting image has an inverted
038 * LUT, i.e., the background value is 0 and marked points have value 255.
039 * 
040 * @author WB
041 * @version 2022/10/03
042 */
043public class Ellipse_Make_Random implements PlugIn {
044        
045        public static class Parameters implements ParameterBundle {
046                
047                @DialogLabel("image title")@DialogStringColumns(12)
048                public String Title = "RandomEllipse"; // Ellipse_Make_Random.class.getSimpleName();
049                
050                @DialogLabel("image width")
051                public int W = 400;
052                @DialogLabel("image height")
053                public int H = 400;
054                
055                @DialogLabel("number of points")
056                public int n = 20;
057                
058                @DialogLabel("ellipse center (xc)")
059                public double xc = 200;
060                
061                @DialogLabel("ellipsecenter (yc)")
062                public double yc = 190;
063                
064                @DialogLabel("major axis radius (ra)")
065                public double ra = 170;
066                
067                @DialogLabel("minor axis radius (rb)")
068                public double rb = 120;
069                
070                @DialogLabel("start angle (deg)")
071                public double angle0 = 0;
072                
073                @DialogLabel("stop angle (deg)")
074                public double angle1 = 180; // was Math.PI/4;
075                
076                @DialogLabel("ellipse orientation (deg)")
077                public double theta = 45;
078                
079                @DialogLabel("x/y noise (sigma)")
080                public double sigma = 5.0; //2.0;
081                
082                @DialogLabel("show real ellipse")
083                public boolean ShowRealCurve = true;
084                @DialogLabel("ellipse color")
085                public BasicAwtColor StrokeColor = BasicAwtColor.Green;
086                @DialogLabel("stroke width")
087                public double StrokeWidth = 1.0;
088        };
089        
090        
091        private static Parameters params = new Parameters();
092        
093        @Override
094        public void run(String arg) {
095                if (!runDialog()) {
096                        return;
097                }
098                
099                GeometricEllipse realEllipse = new GeometricEllipse(params.ra, params.rb, params.xc, params.yc, 
100                                Math.toRadians(params.theta));
101                Pnt2d[] points = new EllipseSampler(realEllipse).getPoints(params.n, 
102                                Math.toRadians(params.angle0), Math.toRadians(params.angle1), params.sigma);
103                
104                ImagePlus im = NewImage.createByteImage(params.Title, params.W, params.H, 1, NewImage.FILL_BLACK);
105                im.setRoi(RoiUtils.toPointRoi(points));
106                
107                ImageProcessor ip = im.getProcessor();
108                for (Pnt2d p : points) {
109                        int u = (int) Math.rint(p.getX());
110                        int v = (int) Math.rint(p.getY());
111                        ip.putPixel(u, v, 255);
112                }
113                ip.invertLut();
114                
115                if (params.ShowRealCurve) {
116                        ShapeOverlayAdapter ola = new ShapeOverlayAdapter();
117                        ColoredStroke circleStroke = new ColoredStroke(params.StrokeWidth, params.StrokeColor.getColor());
118                        ola.addShapes(realEllipse.getShapes(3), circleStroke);
119                        im.setOverlay(ola.getOverlay());
120                }
121                
122                im.show();
123        }
124        
125        // ------------------------------------------
126        
127        private boolean runDialog() {
128                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
129                gd.addMessage(DialogUtils.makeLineSeparatedString(
130                                "This plugin samples points on a given (ideal) ellipse and",
131                                "creates a new image with the sample points marked and also",
132                                "contained in a ROI (float coordinates)."
133                                ));
134                
135                addToDialog(params, gd);
136
137                gd.showDialog();
138                if (gd.wasCanceled())
139                        return false;
140
141                getFromDialog(params, gd);
142
143                return params.validate();
144        }
145
146}
